intro: Tetraplasandra paucidens, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Tetraplasandra paucidens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
